author: Associated Press
title: 2 men sentenced for assault against Jewish man
text:
BOULDER, Colo. â€” A man who pleaded guilty to hitting a Jewish man over the head with a glass for refusing to take off his yarmulke in a Boulder bar has been sentenced to 28 days in jail and a co-defendant was sentenced to five days on a jail work crew.
Bryan Tayefeh and Yotam Monjack each pleaded guilty to hate-crime charges and were sentenced on Friday.
Tayefeh pleaded guilty to felony menacing and a bias-motivated crime and Monjack pleaded guilty to felony criminal mischief and a bias-motivated crime.
The Boulder Daily Camera reports ( http://tinyurl.com/o6x9q62 ) Seth Fineman had to have 20 stitches and suffered permanent injuries.
An attorney for Tayefeh says he had been going through personal issues. Monjack said he is sorry for what he did.
